snippet: The measure is even broader than an earlier draft, extending its call for security to be defended on seabeds, at the poles and in space.
abstract: Chinese government enacts new national security law and continues to hone two other pieces of legislation with similar sweeping restrictions expected to be instated shortly; efforts are viewed as extension of Pres Xi Jinping's agenda of curtailment and bolstering of Communist Party rule.
lead_paragraph: The measure is even broader than an earlier draft, extending its call for security to be defended on seabeds, at the poles and in space.

headline.main: China Approves Sweeping Security Law, Bolstering Communist Rule
headline.print_headline: Chinese Leaders Enact Sweeping Security Law

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Ministry of Public Security of the People's Republic of China
